page.title: 18ANNUAL EVENTS
page.content: { ANNUAL EVENTS} The pram race is an annual Easter event to raise funds for the youth club. 2 children decorate a pram and races are run around St. Keverne, the winner gets a prize. The carnival is held in July. The queen wears a white dress and blue cape. She has 2 attendants. They all sit on a decorated float. There are classes for other entrants. The Ox roast (7th Aug.) begins at 8.30 a.m. when the ox starts to cook in the square. The first piece of ox is auctioned. The gymkhana and donkey derby in the Summer holidays involves pole bending, potato racing, jumping and fancy dress on horse back. At Christmas carols are sung in the square around a huge illuminated tree. Father Christmas arrives with presents for the local children.
